channel.title: [PI] cache downloader help?

item.title: [PI] cache downloader help?
item.dc:creator: @darken4400 darken4400
item.description:
@darken4400 wrote:

hadesflames:

^ That, but actually your best bet is to upload it to your own webserver. Unless you’re planning to run a cheap run-down server with half a player online at most (lol?) then you should be able to afford at least enough to get your content to your players without relying on other people’s bandwidth.

how can i do this and tell me more please?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] cache downloader help?
item.dc:creator: @ipwnunoobs ipwnunoobs
item.description:
@ipwnunoobs wrote:

If i’, right you need a direct link download… try uploading using FileDen or Dropbox (though dropbox does not work most of the time).

Upload your links to that of dropbox or fileden and your good to go.

item.title: [PI] cache downloader help?
item.dc:creator: @darken4400 darken4400
item.description:
@darken4400 wrote:

well ive stopped working on 317’s and started working on a PI server but i encountered a problem.
the thing is that i want to add customs and change the title screen in the cache folder which is located in C:\intdubpkcache and ive uploaded a new cache folder to filefactory and updated the links but now it wont load
ive changed the links in client.java and cachedownloader.java

here are the codes
cachedownloader.java

private final int VERSION = 1; // Version of cache
//private String cacheLink = "http://uppit.com/28ue3guj7atk/CPS.zip"; // Link to cache
private String cacheLink = "http://www.filefactory.com/file/c1207e7/n/intdubpkcache.zip"; // Link to cache

client.java
drawLoadingText(0, “Connecting to File Server…”);
new Update(“http://www.filefactory.com/file/c1207e7/n/intdubpkcache.zip”, “intdubpkcache.zip”, signlink.findcachedir());
abyte0 = decompressors[0].decompress(i);

is there anywhere else im supposed to change it in?

Read full topic
